newsitem.title: UK: Chinese North Korean envoy returns to Beijing - BBC.
newsitem.headline: Chinese North Korean envoy returns to Beijing - BBC.

text.p: The Chinese ambassador in North Korea was summoned back to Beijing on Tuesday, according to a North Korean radio report monitored by the BBC.
"On March 11, Qiao Zonghuai, Chinese ambassador to our country, returned home by plane upon the calling from his country," the BBC quoted North Korean radio as saying.
South Korea and China are negotiating the fate of Hwang Chong-yop, a Pyongyang defector who sought refuge four weeks ago in Beijing's Seoul consulate.
Hwang, a senior North Korean ideological theoretician and top aide to supreme leader Kim Jong-il, is the highest North Korean official to flee the Stalinist state.
Talks have failed to end a diplomatic standoff despite a personal bid by North Korean foreign minister Kim Yong-nam to break the deadlock.
On Monday, a Seoul foreign ministry official said he believed Beijing had ruled out sending Hwang back to North Korea.
